report_title: Industry Research: Health Food & Supplement Store Franchises
executive_summary: The Health Food and Supplement Store Franchises industry has expanded, albeit modestly, over the five years to 2022. During the period, health-conscious consumers have increasingly purchased alternative medicines and natural remedies that have not been traditionally available at retail stores. Moreover, increasing awareness of the benefits of industry products provides a lucrative and expanding market for franchises. In light of the COVID-19 pandemic, industry franchises have benefited from increased sales of nutritional supplements and vitamins, as consumers seek ways to boost immunity for themselves and family. Still, rising competition over the past five years from e-tailers and big-box stores has tempered industry growth. In all, industry revenue is expected to increase an annualized 1.3% to $824.8 million over the five years to 2022, including 0.5% growth in 2022 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue growth in line with consumer preferences
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the five years to 2022, the industry has grown relatively in line with shifting consumer preferences toward natural and organic products. Americans spend billions on dietary supplements, foods and devices that bolster health and wellness, illustrating the large market for franchises.
The industry has been characterized by rising external competition from e-tailers and big-box stores over the past five years, which has tempered revenue growth and constrained profit margins.

The industry is subject to regulations at the food manufacturing level for products making health claims, which translates to regulations at the retailing level. Regulatory scrutiny has increased in recent years due to noncompliance issues.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the five years to 2027, industry revenue is forecast to increase modestly at an annualized 0.4% to $842.3 million as demand for vitamins and supplements remains high, but external competition intensifies.
The trend of digitalization could provide opportunities for franchises to invest in digital platforms showing supply chain transparency, differentiating their offerings.
Increasing price competition from online and big-box retailers is expected to place downward pressure on profit margins for industry franchises over the next five years.

industry_definition: This industry sells health food and nutritional supplements.

mixed_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: medium - steady

key_trends: Heightened demand for health products prevented a more significant decline in industry revenue
External competitive pressures make the market for industry goods more price competitive

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers in this segment usually have higher disposable income and can afford nonessential health products. This age group is increasingly concerned with having a healthy lifestyle and has turned to organic and dietary supplements due to their proposed health benefits.

Consumers in this segment typically use multivitamin multimineral and sports nutrition products. Sports nutrition products are more frequently being used by fitness enthusiasts, weekend sports players.
While this consumer segment is the smallest market for sport nutrition products, consumers aged over 65 demand a large portion of vitamins and minerals to support aging health needs.

Consumers in this age segment generally are college-aged students, many still living at home. Similarly, consumers in this age bracket generally do not have established careers and have limited disposable income.

products_and_services.product_description: Food and Beverages sold in stores.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Vitamins, Minerals and Other Dietary Supplements

products_and_services.product_description: Nutrition products tailored for sports enthusiasts.

tier_1_suppliers: Vitamin & Supplement Manufacturing in the US
Medical Supplies Wholesaling in the US
Drug, Cosmetic & Toiletry Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Aging Population and Consumer Healthcare Trends
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The aging US population and the trend toward more consumer-oriented healthcare products are increasing demand for vitamin and food supplements that can be taken as preventative measures.

The general health of the population also contributes to industry demand. With conditions such as heart disease, cancer, obesity, arthritis, and stress becoming increasingly prevalent, demand for supplements and related consumables is rising.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Healthcare Costs and Demand for Alternatives
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for lower cost alternatives to prescription drugs and for preventative measures is anticipated to increase, particularly as healthcare costs continue to trend higher.
New scientific research that links the benefits of herbs, vitamins, and minerals to human health and wellbeing are drivers of consumer demand for industry products as well.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The Health Food and Supplement Store Franchises industry sells primarily to the domestic market.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Imports and Exports in Manufacturing Industries
international_trade_points.trade_description: However, products sold by this industry are sourced from several suppliers, including those that are based overseas. The value of imports and exports sold by this industry is accounted for in the relevant manufacturing industries.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the largest share of establishments, home to 25.4% in 2022.
This is followed by the West (19.2%) region.
The Mid-Atlantic (16.0%) region also has a significant presence.
The Great Lakes region has a slightly higher percentage of establishments (around 15%) compared to its population percentage (around 12%).
On the other hand, the Southwest region has a lower percentage of establishments (around 10%) compared to its population percentage (around 15%).
On a state basis, California has the most health store locations and generates the most sales for the industry; California alone accounts for 13.1% of establishments in 2022.
Florida also holds a significant share of industry operators, accounting for 8.9% of establishments in 2022.
New York accounts for the third-largest amount of industry franchises by state, comprising 6.9% in 2022.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The FDA and FTC regulate the labeling, marketing, distribution, and sale of dietary supplements, including vitamins, minerals and herbs.
Quality System (QS) Regulations governed by the FDA are applicable to the industry to ensure products are safe and effective.
The FDA has introduced new regulations surrounding nutrition and supplement fact labels, such as requiring added sugars information.

barriers_points.barrier_description: While the market share concentration in the industry is moderate, existing retailers have developed strong relationships with wholesale distributors, ensuring that they receive the most competitive prices that can then be passed on to customers, as the company maintains and expands its market share. Additionally, some players are subsidiaries of vertically integrated supplement manufacturers. This gives their retail operations a competitive price and supply advantage.

There are significant upfront costs associated with opening a new franchise. For example, start-up costs for opening a GNC Holdings Inc. (GNC) franchise range between $149,722 and $388,630, according to Entrepreneur. Additionally, the company charges a franchise fee of $40,000 and an ongoing royalty fee of 6.0%. In addition to the upfront costs associated with opening a new franchise, franchisors typically have strict financial requirements. GNC franchisee applicants must also have at least $130,000 in liquid assets. Thus, initial capital costs pose a significant barrier to entry for potential entrants.

While rising competition from big-box retailers, such as Walmart Inc. and Target Corporation, is not a barrier to enter the industry, competition does pose a significant barrier to success for potential entrants.

basis_points.basis_description: This industry is highly price competitive, particularly for nonessential general categories and consumables such as multivitamin tablets and vitamin, mineral, and food supplements.

Participants also compete on the basis of product quality and range. The ability to provide a wide product range that satisfies most consumer needs is an important basis from which to compete within this industry.

basis_points.basis_title: Location, store setup, and customer service
basis_points.basis_description: Location and store setup play an additional role, with industry operators ideally aiming to be exposed to high shopping traffic areas (i.e., shopping malls and strip malls) or any area that is convenient to customers.

concentration_points.concentration_description: GNC Holdings Inc. (GNC), the industry's largest player, is expected to account for the largest share of industry revenue.
Although the industry has a moderate level of internal competition, due to the industry's concentrated nature, external competition has been steadily rising.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Rising competition has constrained industry profit growth, as big-box and online retailers widen their offerings of health foods, nutritional supplements and vitamins to accommodate increasing consumer demand for these items.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: In 2022, for every $1.00 allocated toward wages, an estimated $0.05 is spent on capital expenditures.
Typically, franchisees purchase equipment and supplies directly from the franchisor or from suppliers that the franchisor has formed contracts with.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Robust demand for health foods and supplements from the burgeoning elderly population, coupled with many health-conscious consumers preferring organic, non-GMO food products, has resulted in stable demand for industry products.
The financing environment may determine whether or not new franchisees can enter the market, adding to industry revenue volatility.
Negative media attention pertaining to multivitamins and supplements containing ingredients not listed on the label could deter consumer demand for industry products.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: GNC Holdings Inc. (GNC) is leading the industry in tracking customer purchases with the use of technology via membership award benefits.
Operators use centralized automated checkout stands to process sales.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators can benefit from retailing a wide range of health products, from weight-loss pills to dietary supplements.

FAQs.question: Do your company's advertising campaigns target a wide range of consumers?
FAQs.answer: While some consumers look to industry goods to change their weight or body mass, others use supplements just to improve general health conditions.

FAQs.question: What steps do you take to retain talented employees with specialized knowledge?
FAQs.answer: As big-box retailers begin to stock more industry products, operators can attract consumers by providing exceptional, knowledgeable sales service.

FAQs.question: How have high royalty fees impacted your operations?
FAQs.answer: Parent companies often charge high royalty fees to their franchisees.

FAQs.question: How has your company reacted to the rise of online sales over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Online retailers have been the biggest threat to industry operators, as online platforms offer a wider selection of products and allow consumers to compare prices and read product reviews.

FAQs.question: How does your company utilize technology like membership reward programs in its operations?
FAQs.answer: Membership programs encourage customers to make repeat purchases and enables the company to enhance customer loyalty.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: The Food and Drug Administration has recently implemented significant changes to labeling laws regarding industry goods.

FAQs.question: What does your company do to remain compliant with new consumer regulations?
FAQs.answer: Staying up to date on potential regulatory changes can enable operators to make changes more efficiently and effectively.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins have fluctuated drastically over the past five years amid increasing price competition and regulation.

FAQs.question: What ongoing financing challenges does your company face?
FAQs.answer: Royalty fees often present a significant and ongoing cost for many industry operators.

FAQs.question: How often do you perform a stock assessment? How do you keep storage costs low?
FAQs.answer: Adequate stock controls can reduce inventory costs and increase stock turnover.

FAQs.question: Do you employ any professionals in the health field? How?
FAQs.answer: Knowledgeable and experienced staff are more capable in advising clients on what supplements or apparatus would best suit the customer's requirements, especially when competing with mass retailers.

FAQs.question: How do you respond to variability in consumer demand?
Ability to alter goods and services produced in favor of market conditions
FAQs.answer: Health stores must evaluate their offerings to meet consumer demands and differentiate from competitors.

FAQs.question: Do you find revenue trends to be in line with changes in competition? What products do customers tend to buy when competition is high?
FAQs.answer: When external competition rises, the health foods market becomes more saturated, limiting opportunities for franchises to enter the industry.

FAQs.question: How can you entice consumers with rising disposable income levels to shop at your establishment?
FAQs.answer: Typically, organic and nonGMO products command a higher price point than other food products.

FAQs.question: How closely do you track trends in healthy eating? How do changes in healthy eating affect your business?
FAQs.answer: A rising healthy eating index is indicative of a more health-conscious population, which bolsters consumer demand for health food and supplements from industry franchises.
